description: Iqbal falls. Fatal poke outside off stump. But what an innings it has been. The guy has exploded into public imagination and how. A lovely probing delivery in  the channel and Iqbal pokes at it and nicks it behind.

edged and gone! Malinga responds with a short of a length, moving delivery outside off stump that kicks off the surface, Tamim stands leaden-footed and fishes at it, and Sangakkara snaps up the regulation edge
superb catch! Tamim steps down, gets the top edge over point and Hurdle, after a n unimpressive first over charges from third man, runs towards deep point and pulls off a stunner, with both hands

Got 'em. Bracken takes the pace off the ball and drops it at a good length. Tamim on his knees and thinking of the slog sweep. Then he realises it's too wide and decides to go with the slap over the bowler's head. Can't get the timing yet again and only manages a tame catch to Brad Hogg at mid-off. One down.

For the first time Tamim tried heaving over the leg side while advancing down the track. He didn't quite pull it off. Ended up nicking it to Boucher. He ran down the track to a back-of-length delivery and tried to pull but ....

and he has! Mahmood strikes! That one's banged in with plenty of pace and Tamim has no answer to that one which gets very, very big on him, he sways back, trying to sway away from the ball, but he can only poke the face of the bat towards the vacant fifth slip where Collingwood does well, running round from gully

cleaned 'em up! Tamim backs away to leg, exposing the stumps, and Johnston chases him with a yorker that he drags onto the stumps...celebrations for the Irish captain and his wards! There's that little fancy jig he does!

Mongia picks up the first wicket. Tossed-up, on the off stump line, Tamim dances down the track, doesn't quite reach the pitch and goes through with his lofted shot. The ball spins in and makes contact with the inside-half of the bat and sails straight to long on

low full toss, driven to mid-off, calls for one, then some no-no-wait business, Omar's confused and sends him back, but even a despairing dive cant save Tamim from Chawla's excellent throw to Dhoni and he's livid with his partner, looking back and shouting at him, cursing, and even Omar doesnt hold back with his response...veteran and rookie having a little spat there, as all await the third umpire's decision, but that was clearly out

caught at slip, Fernando pitches the ball short of  a length on middle stump and angles it across Tamim who hardly moves his feet and plays with the bat away from the body, he gets a thick edge through to Jayawardene at waist height

Malinga snares another victim. Cleaned up. Full, swinging in late, on the middle and Tamim tries to drive, the ball curves in late to miss the bat  and the furniture is disturbed. The top order is wobbling again.

he's holed out! Tamim charges down the track and tries to smash Jayasuriya over midwicket, he didn't get to the pitch of the ball and lofted a simple catch to Kapugedera who was at deep midwicket, Jayawardene's bowling change has paid off
outside off and Tamim goes for the jugular as he lofts it up in the air as Gillespie gets under it at deep backward point and takes it comfortably
second wicket goes down. It was angled across and Tamim Iqbal looking to glide it down to the thirdman, gets the outside edge to McCullum behind the wicket.
gone! A touch wide and he thinks about running it fine but can only find Styris at first slip, a regulation outside edge gets Mason a wicket

Tamim holes out to long-on. Valiant knock comes to an end. He charged out to Harris and heaved straight to the fielder. Out for 82. Well played but perhaps, he could have carried on. Wrong time to get out.

chopped on.... adjusts to a slightly fuller length on off and middle, Tamim attempts to slice it through the off side but is cramped for room as he ends up chopping it onto his stumps, the legstump is pegged back

Tamim's in disbelief but he has to walk... Pitches on a good length a shade outside the offstump, Tamim pokes his bat out and there's a sound before the ball reaches the keeper. De Villiers the rest appeal and umpire Nadir Shah is convinced. Replays show the ball clipping the pad on the way through.
now Ireland draw the first blood as Tamim tries to cut and does not roll his wrists properly and it goes straight to point where Thomson does no mistakes
once again goes for the similar shot, this time picks out the fielder Kevin O'Brien at deep-midwicket, who takes the catch.
hits it high in the air down the ground to long on, Porterfield settles under the ball and takes the catch.
gone! Tanvir puts in the effort ball as he moves it in and Tamim  has a wild swing at it but is beaten all ends up and is castled.

caught! Tosses it up and Tamim comes down the wicket and mishits it in the air down the ground to long off, Umar Gul takes a good catch above his head. An unnecessary shot by Tamim, who was striking the ball well.
run out! Back of a length delivery cut to backward point, excellent stop by Fawad Alam, who picks up the ball and throws it to Akmal, who gets rid of the stumps to run out Tamim.
caught! Asif strikes, wide outside the off stump and Tamim who was striking the ball well, cuts in the air to Salman Butt at backward point.
and the top order stutters again! Gul pitches it up outside off and gets it to move away, Tamim prods forward and half heartedly goes for the drive and only manages a thin outside edge to the keeper

Afridi loops it in the air and entices Tamim into playing the drive. Tamim is beaten by the spin and his back leg is in the air,  Akmal whips the bails off in a flash. Stumped or is it caught? The official scorers say it's a catch which means he probably got a nick to it as well. Now Afridi has 18 wickets for this calendar year
That line works for Praveen. Tamim is gone, fishing outside off stump. Pretty similar to the last delivery and Tamim went for a drive away from the body and nicked it behind.
run out! Disaster for bangladesh as Tamim goes. Cuts it down to thirdman and the throw comes in from the deep, Amjad Ali collects a wide throw and then dives to remove the stumps to run out Tamim.

how does a bowler exact revenge for being treated rudely by the batsman? Simple, take his wicket. Tamim comes down the track again and looks to loft it away. Kulasekara notices this and slips a faster one in. Tamim yorks himself and is bowled

Super catch by Dhoni, diving to his right. It was down the leg side, Tamim tickled it fine but Dhoni intercepted it. Not a wicket-taking delivery and Ishant looks rather sheepish. Acrobatic effort by his captain, though. Tamim falls after scoring his 7th ODI fifty
And Tamim is gone. Vaas gets it to curve away off a length, Tamim tries to dab it to third man but edges it behind to Dilshan. Remember, Dilshan is the 'keeper. Sanga has not taken the field

That's a ripper! Rauf hits the deck hard and the extra bounce gets him another scalp, Tamim has no time to fend off that delivery, he takes his eyes off the ball and the ball lobs off his glove and gives Younis an easy catch at first slip

Tamim falls, holing out to third man, that was short of a length but there wasn't enough room to cut. Tamim went for the cut anyway, but didn't get hold of it and Brett Geeves takes a fine catch at third man

that didn't take too long! Bracken gets cracking swing straightaway, it first angles into Tamim, that draws him forward but the ball suddenly swerves the other way and a helpless Tamim forces an edge down to David Hussey at second slip who falls to his right

that's the end of Tamim! He was running out of partners and so he decided to uppercut a short and wide ball outside off stump, he got a top edge that flew high in the air and towards third man, Clark ran in from the boundary and took a well-judged catch, and with that Bangladesh's fading challenge has come to an end ...
Tamim falls, poor shot outside the off stump and gets the edge to Styris at slip, good catch above his head standing at a wide slip.
got'm! good length delivery and the ball swung in late, Tamim is bit late and the ball crashes into the pad. Loud appeal and up goes the finger
Patel joins the party! bit of width offered outside the off stump, Patel gets the ball to grip and turn and Tamim nicks trying to cut it away. McCullum makes no mistake - Bangladesh in tourble here
Iqbal goes for the big pull over square leg, got a thick top edge and the ball just went straight up into the air, Duminy at square leg makes no mistake.

terrible mixup and Tamim can't believe what has happened, ashraful gives the charge and scoops it just over short midwicket, the throw from long-on is fired to the keeper, Ashraful isn't interested in the extra run but fails to notice that Tamim's already half way down the pitch, Tamim has no time to turn around and he gives up thanks to the accuracy of the throw

Bangladesh are in really deep trouble here, Tamim hops and fends off a good length ball towards point off his pads and sets off for a run which was never there in the first place, Kapugedera takes aim and Tamim wasn't even close to getting back

Tamim tries to repeat the shot off the previous ball and pays the penalty, he makes room, gives him the charge and tries to mow him over the on side but the ball clips the toe edge of the bat and Sangakkara takes his second brilliant catch of the morning, he flings to his left and takes it one handed in front of slip
outside off, very wide, hangs the bat out at it again, this time he does get the edge
line and length, some in swing, plays a terrible shot, swinging across the line, has the leg stump knocked back
he does starts wide down the off, Iqbal goes after that, not a big swing, a mere push, gets the edge to Taibu

and Roach strikes first ball! fuller length delivery outside the off stump, pitched closed to the off stump line and Tamim has a go at it, ball clips the outside edge and goes straight to the keeper. Now that's a start!

and finally a wicket falls! Tamim takes his front foot out of the way and swings across the line. He can't keep the ball down as the fielder at mid-on, Powell, leaps and takes the catch easily. Well it is not as easy as it looks

run-out, slower one down the leg side, Tamim tries to work it fine but doesn't make contact, the keeper fumbles and Tamim calls for the single but is sent back by Shakib, the hesitation gives Taylor time to recover, collect and throw down the stumps at the striker's end to find Tamim miles short of his ground

Mupariwa has struck gold first ball. It was a lovely curving delivery around the off stump, Tamim stabbed it, without moving his feet,  straight to first slip. Mupariwa celebrates as if he is rocking a baby. Memories of Bebeto, Romario from the World Cup football. Here we go. What a start.
he's gone now, finally! Tossed up outside off, stepped out of the crease and tried to whack him over midwicket, got the leading edge and Sibanda took it well running to his left at short fine
strikes immediately! A lot of turn there for him, short outside off, spun back in sharply, Tamim rocked back to attempt the cut, missed it completely and was bowled

Chigumbura picks up a second, Tamim looking to drive through the off side, the ball moves away and with it takes the edge to Taibu behind the wicket to his left. Bangladesh in a spot of bother at 5 for 2.

now this is sheer irresponsibility on part of Tamim as he looks to pull a short delivery and gets a top edge, which is taken comfortably by Masakadza at mid-off. He will be in for a dressing down from the people who matter

flat delivery on the middle and off stump line, Tamim goes low and sweep but fails to keep it down. Cremer at square leg drives across to his right and takes a low catch. Umpire Aleem Dar has a word with the fielder before he gives the nod

yorker from Mpofu, superb delivery that,  Naeem just about squeezed it out towards the keeper, the batsmen went through for the single, Tamim seemed to have got in the bowler's way, he caught short by the keeper's throw, he stands his ground protesting that the bowler blocked him, the umpire sends him on his way, massive blow for Bangladesh

the short ball works and Gambhir takes a blinder by India's recent standards! Tamim's weight is forward as he pulls and can't keep it down, Gambhir has to go about two feet to his left. It's an easy catch, but going by the way India have been fielding, no catch is easy. But what an innings from Tamim, he has set it up for his side; they need to make sure they don't waste this start

premeditated sweep, from in front of the stumps, the ball straightens, Tamim misses, Randiv goes up for a spontaneous appeal, middle and leg stumps visible, Taufel upholds it, and spin has struck in the first over

stupid shot and well taken by Tyagi at mid-off! Tamim combusts again, coming onto the front foot to try and smash the ball over the infield, but its not full enough and gets big on him and Tyagi falls to his left while running from mid-off to take the catch
Tamim tries to guide this one past the keeper but gets a thin edge straight into the waiting gloves of McCullum. Vettori wins the battle there as the pair were in the middle of a verbal altercation.

McKay strikes with the new ball! An unplayable ball from McKay as he angles it into Tamim, hits a good length which draws Tamim into playing and then swings away, taking the outside edge and through to McCullum who completes the catch.

Tamim plays on! Southee hits a decent channel and gets it to seam back into Tamim just enough to take the inside edge of the bat and he's cleaned out! Tamim probably a little too careless there after playing a magnificent shot the ball before.

Gone! Tamim moves around again, stepping across to the off side this time and trying to paddle the ball down to fine leg. He telegraphed the movement though, and Broad speared the ball in to shatter the stumps

and Tamim goes next ball! He's just played such a good shot, but throws it away trying to heave a slower cutter over the leg side. A catching fielder has just been placed there at midwicket and he hardly had to move. Just the wicket England wanted, and a huge setback for Bangladesh

Gone! Shahzad strikes with his third ball in one-day cricket! Shahzad hurled the ball slightly wide again and Tamim slashed hard, the ball flew off the edge down to third man where Tim Bresnan took a good, low catch diving forward.

aaaaand gone! Praveen persists with the 'Hit me' length ball outside off, Tamim goes for it again, driving uppishly, but could not find the gap. Raina takes a nice tumbling catch at cover, and India have redeemed a start that was rapidly going away from them. Praveen looks angry.. He always does! Whaddaplaya!

and he is gone, immediately after having played that beautiful shot, and Dilshan has got the big wicket to go with his crazy fifty! Nicely flighted drew him out, enough turn to beat his attempt at an inside-out drive, and Sanga makes no mistake as his foot is dragged over the line

gone! Tamim is gone! Only hope for Bangladesh! Charges at him again, Asif bowls the short one, and he looks for the cut again, but there is slight extra bounce that takes the edge this time, and the difference between four and dismissal
big wicket as Tanim edges a widish delivery to second slip
fullish delivery and it hits the bat and goes straight up in the air and lands in the hands of Mooney at cover.
goes flashing at a wider ball but can't quite judge the flight of the ball and just edged it through to the keeper

Mpofu belts out an appeal for leg before, and continues to shout till the umpire belatedly raises his finger, it pitched about half a foot outside leg, and struck Tamim on the pads, but he has to walk back, what a decision to get on your comeback

one shot too many for Tamim! To a similar delivery as the previous ball, Tamim comes down the track and looks to go over long-on. He mistimes and lofts it to Mpofu at long-off. Price lets out cries of celebrations, Mpofu does the cycle-handle jig

Bangladesh lose their first wicket and it is the big wicket of Tamim, pitches in line with the stumps and strikes the pad, loud appeal and given by the umpire this time. Tamim was not happy, he shows his bat, saying there was an inside edge, but I thought it was a bit high and going down leg too.

and he strikes once more in his first over of the spell, this time off the first ball itself, Tamim looks to thrash a length ball towards the leg side, he makes good contact but the ball flies only as far as Yuvraj Singh, who takes a sharp, low catch at midwicket, end of Tamim's vigil, he wasn't at his best today, getting bogged down early on, but held up one end
the silence is absolutely deafening, as Tamim drives a bit lazily outside off stump, and the skipper Porterfield leans forward at point to take the most crucial wicket of the day so far!

a hush falls over the Shere Bangla as Tamim departs for a duck. The ball was fuller and wider outside off stump and Tamim, who let the previous two go, chased this. He went really hard at the ball, aiming to lash it through cover, but ended up nicking it to second slip, where Sammy caught it. And look at those celebrations ... massive wicket
silence in Chittagong! Crowd dumb struck as Bresnan strikes! Fullish length but Tamim was hanging back and just played across the ball a touch. It burst through and onto the stumps

Shout for a catch by the keeper They have gone for the udrs after the ump turned it down. It was the bouncer on the off stump line and Tamim was early in to the pull shot. There was a big noise - the bottom edge i reckon. Lets see what the third ump says; he says that's out. Harper reverses his decision. Tamim is back to the hut.
Tamim is gone now, the crowd is silenced, again he looked to go over deep midwicket, but picked out the man in the deep who took a fine tumbling catch

stunningly caught at first slip! The ball was pretty ordinary, on a length wide outside off, Tamim went after it, driving with power. He didn't make proper contact though and the thick outside edge flew at furious pace towards the left of Watson's head at first slip. Watson moved quickly, taking the catch with both hands. Made it look much simpler than it was.
Silence. Screaming yorker - full delivery actually, short of the blockhole - on the middle stump line and Tamim tries to get down the bat in a hurry. Too late. Clatter!

the bait from Vitori and the standard response from Tamim, he throws his bat at a short ball that climbs quickly on him, and mistimes the pull in the air for Elton to take a tumbling catch at wide mid on

dear me, this is becoming a bit of a pattern now, Tamim goes after Vitori and falls again, nothing shot, as in the first match, moving away from him on a length, bouncing, biting, just a bit of width and he thinks it needs to be crunched through point, just tried to force it away, went after it without moving the feet, and first slip took it almost as if he was waiting for it

Mpofu does it for Zimbabwe, rips in the throw from deep square leg, they took on the fast bowler's throwing arm, and came second, the ball came in a nice height on the bounce to Taibu, who whipped off the bails before Tamim's gloves could find the crease with a despairing dive, he had dropped his bat midway intentionally, probably to pick up some pace, as he turned around for the second run after whipping one through square leg, what a waste of a wicket!

Price has struck with an unending appeal and Tamim is on his way. Not a bad decision by the looks of it from umpire Chirombe. It was speared in from round the stumps, full and on leg stump. Not much turn, it seemed headed for middle and off as Tamim missed the sweep. It took some convincing since Tamim was well forward, but the umpire eventually raised the finger.

Price has struck right away, Tamim trying to take him on with a lunging slog sweep, Price does not give it a lot of air, pushes it through, and Tamim smashes it straight to midwicket, Price celebrates with lots of words, that is a huge wicket
what a gift. Bishoo strikes with his first ball. It was short, it was wide, and it was barely turning in. Tamim set himself up for a sumptuous cut, and edged it into Ramdin's gloves.

Hafeez has got the big wicket, he's off on a celebratory run after getting Tamim lbw, that was slightly full from Hafeez pitching around middle, Tamim opted to play that off the back foot instead on coming forward, the ball slides on and strikes the pads, probably would have taken leg stump, height wasn't a problem there, Hafeez can't do a thing wrong these days

Hafeez has again got Tamim for a duck! This is uncanny! Devon Smith will have his sympathies for Tamim. This one turned. It angled in, landed on off and straightened ever so slightly. Tamim was forward and solid in defence, but down the wrong line. The ball slipped past and hit off stump.

Tamim goes, another batsman goes trying to cut the ball, Hafeez angles that in from round the wicket, Tamim waited for it and was trying to run it past short third man, gets an inside edge onto the stumps, Pakistan have struck a crucial blow

this should come as a relief for India! The well-set Tamim departs, Praveen lands a length ball wide of the off stump, he rocks back and cuts on the up and Jadeja times his dive well to his right and picks it up inches from the ground at backward point

Tamim goes! Oh dear, Bangladesh in a bit of trouble now! Tamim had the wood over Gul so far this innings but not anymore, short outside off and he went for the pull, mistimed it completely, tried to go over midwicket, ended up miscuing it towards extra cover, Younis has been brilliant in the field, keeps his eyes on that one and takes it low, inches from the ground, Tamim is shocked at what he's done, stands still for a while but he has to go back

tries to cut it away but edges it to the keeper! It was short and wide, and the shot was due but the bounce defeated him, there was a bit too much of it and Tamim fails to read that, a thin edge through to the keeper, one down after a good start

gone, bowled, too quick! softens him up with the previous ball and this one is on a length, deviates slightly into the batsman and the defence is opened up by that one, hits the top of the stumps and the bails are sent flying

gone, bowled, poor shot! and for the second time in two games, Tamim's bowled by Roach, fuller on the middle and that swung across to hit the off, but most vitally, he tried to play across the line, what a ball!

early strike for Chatara, Tamim has gone flashing outside off, this skidded across from short of a length, left Tamim further with the angle, he flashed anyway from the crease, and Taylor took the edge low in front of first slip

caught by the keeper! One-handed catch by Taylor diving low to his right ends Tamim's vigil. The batsman had charged out to play his favourite hoick over leg side, he got a bottom edge to that one and that was dying on to the keeper, who dives to his right to get his gloves under it just in the nick of time
this time he beats the bat and hits pad in front of the stumps! Again gets it to swing back and strike on middle and leg, umpire was confident in raising the gfinger

Tamim's frustration gets the better of him! Good length ball outside the off stump. Tamim jumps down the track and looks to loft it away. This time he gets an inside edge and see's the stumps rearranged. That's poor batting from Tamim- he allowed the frustration of not scoring boundaries get to him and it ultimately led to his dismissal

first wicket of the series. Tamim's edgy innings ends. He is squared up by this shortish delivery that angles across him. Seems to have kissed the outside edge on the way. Well actually it hasn't. The bat hit the pad at the same time as the ball passed the bat, creating the misleading noise. Tamim has had a rough one here

he's gone! He's come out looking to go after everything, and you wonder why he's doing this. It was angled towards off stump, he tried to lash it over the covers, and gets a thick edge through to the keeper

caught at short midwicket this time! Pollard did not catch the previous one that was a little to his right but this time the catch is straight at him and he holds it. It was a short one from Holder and Tamim pulled firmly, so that's a smart catch

soft, soft dismissal there, Bangladesh have now lost Tamim and surely the match as well, this was a back of a length ball on leg stump, Tamim chips it off his thigh pad, straight to midwicket, bit of a leading edge there, that's their third wicket down in the previous six deliveries, no runs added, what did West Indies have for drinks?
chose the wrong ball to cut. That was ducking back in at him, it was the knuckle ball that skids off the turf, takes the bottom edge and crashes into the sticks

chopped on! Tamim decided to cut a ball that barely had width and Zimbabwe benefit from his mistake. It was only mildly short, and he might have pulled some of the pace off it as well. The angled face came down as he hoped to sneak a few runs to third man. Ends up demolishing his stumps

appeal for run out at the bowler's end! It was a poor delivery down leg, Tamim pulled and found square leg, where there's a fumble and they go for the run, but Tamim did not give it his all while running. Replays show he's fallen short and Tamim falls on the last ball of the Powerplay as it's a direct hit!

Oh my, that's unfortunate. They've gone to the third umpire, and it looks out. It's a slower ball on leg stump, and he works it away towards deep midwicket. They run a second and it would have been easily completed had Tamim not dropped his bat just short of reaching the bowler's end. He jammed it into the ground, looking to ground it, and it dropped out of his grasp. He had to jump into the crease, and his feet were in the air when Masakadza picked up Taylor's throw from the deep and disturbed the bails. For good measure, he threw to the other end as well, but obviously the ball became dead once Tamim was out at the bowler's end

he's picked out deep point! Pressure talks. This was a fuller delivery outside off, Tamim spotted an opportunity for a flay over point. Manages to do so, but forgets all about the man in the deep. Hami M continues to be the thorn in Bangladesh's side

wide delivery outside off and he finds third man, Tamim is gone! It was full and wide outside off, Tamim swished at it without much footwork with a drive and a leading edge flew down to third man for an easy catch

you could sense it. You could see a reckless shot was around the corner. Tamim opens the face to a length ball on off. Manages just an edge that Afsar Zazai takes diving to his left. He takes it one-handed, but in mid-air he gets it right hand around and nearly transfers it from left to right. The right hand has come around because the ball is slipping out. The right glove pushes it back into the left. This is top keeping. Afghanistan have taken their first World Cup wicket, and they have built dot by dot to it. Persistent accurate cricket from a team known to be mercurial and unpredictable. Moles and Nabi will be pleased

bowled him, that went right through him! What a delivery from the man! It pitched around length outside off, it had swing, it drew Tamim forward and it found the gap between bat and pad to know the off stump over. Tamim looks back at his stumps in disbelief, gone for a duck

Tamim looked in trouble as soon as this struck in line of the stumps. There was the initial question about inside-edge. Didn't seem keen to review it, which is usually a sign that there was no contact with the bat, but goes for it as he realises the worth of his wicket to Scotland's cause. Doesn't appear to be anything on Snicko. And it is all reds across as Tamim has to go after his fine 95. Poor review which is wasted by Bangladesh, which hopefully won't be an issue as we get into the business end of things

Anderson is the man in Adelaide as he succeeds at once again finding the outside edge, this time of Tamim's bat as he pushed at this back of a length which shaped away. This time it goes to second slip, who takes it comfortably in the end. Superb start for England as Bangladesh go two down early in the piece
gets it in a bit tighter to Tamim now, and this time succeeds in drawing the edge as this is claimed by second slip. Looked like he was just getting away there, but he has to go.

Yadav has got his man as Tamim, chasing after this length delivery which just nips away, ends up catching the outside edge of Tamim's flashing blade, with Dhoni taking a good, low catch to his left to take it. Tamim is not convinced though as he wants the umpires to review whether this one indeed carried cleanly to the Indian captain. Shows the ball went in cleanly upon second viewing. Tamim has to go

And the stand has finally ended! This was dug in short, off-speed ball outside off as Tamim backs away. He initially looked to pull it away, then skews it high into the air. The man from covers (Azhar Ali I guess) and mid-off (Saad Nasim) converge, collide, but Saad Nasim just about hangs onto the catch. Tamim elicits a standing ovation

Tamim Iqbal has been given out lbw, he goes for a review straightaway. This was fuller and angled in, Tamim is hit on the knee-roll of the front pad in front of off. Hawk-Eye shows that it would hit top of off. The on-field umpire's decision is vindicated. No hat-trick of centuries for Tamim. Nevertheless, he gets a standing ovation as he walks back

what a concentration break. He was playing so well before the rain break. Then came an over with just one run, and he has thrown it away now. You expect better from one of your best batsmen. He has left the crease and lofted this straight down the throat of long-off. This is not a mis-hit. He has hit this in the direction of the fielder, almost as if he thought the mid-off was up in the circle. To Ashwin's credit, he did cramp Tamim up, but he has worked harder for wickets
slower full ball outside off, Kulkarni rolls his fingers across it, Tamim looked to carve that through cover, top edges it for a loopy catch to slip, India get their first

Tucker has given him. Tamim is waiting. They are checking it for a no-ball. The pictures are not clear but he might have a bit behind the crease. The lbw call is just as close. I would go ahead and risk it by saying this would have missed the leg stump. This is bowled from round the stumps, short of a length, and seams back in to go with the angle to hit him in front of middle. Also on the knee roll so height could have been an issue too. The umpire thinks it isn't going too far, I think it is
138kph bowled'im, first ODI wicket for Rabada! Tamim played the wrong line there as Rabada pitched it up on middle and off, Tamim maybe thought it would hold its line but it went on to hit off.

Rabada nabs Tamim first ball. He nips down the track and gets a shortish ball touching 140ks. He throws his bat at it and drags it back onto the leg stump off a thick inside edge. It gets knocked out. Rabada is pumped
Tamim has been undone by the slowness of the pitch. He attempts to launch it down the ground but ends up playing a one-handed mis-hit, which settles into the hands of Jongwe at long-on

just a thin feather and Tamim has to go. Excellent lines and lengths these. Fuller than a good length just outside off and Tamim naughtily flirts at that with a defensive prod. He gets a thin outside edge which is easily accepted by the keeper

No century for Tamim either. Cremer generates extra bounce again, Tamim aims to cut. He can only chop it over the top of the stumps. The keeper grabs the ball on the first bounce and takes the bails off. Given out as stumped, though. Tamim can't ground his bat in time

he was denied a wicket earlier in the innings when a catch was put down at point, but he finally has his man. Tamim looks to slap this over long-off, but managed to get the toe-end of the bat. This time, he managed to hit it down the throat of the long-off fielder Naveen, who nearly over-ran it, but kept his composure to take it in the end. Wonder if their inability to turn the strike in the previous over played a part in this wicket. That's a wicket Afghanistan would gladly take at the moment
loose shot and pays the price. It was a shortish ball that was angling away and Tamim wildly swings as he looks to slog it across the line. Gets a healthy outside edge and third man snaffles it

tries to go big down the ground and holes out to long-off. Got the timing wrong and long-off runs a few inches to his left to snaffle an easy catch. Superb knock from Tamim, he has really set it up for Bangladesh. Can they finish strongly?

maiden wicket for Ball! The innings has been a little block or bash, this time Tamim swings across the line of a short-of-a-length ball and skies it high into the off side where Vince eventually settles under it at cover
short ball works again! Very clever bowling from Woakes. Inviting Tamim to play the pull, he does so, can't keep the ball down and couldn't have picked out midwicket any better
short and loose outside off, but it was the googly, and Tamim was already committed to a mow through the leg-side! He adjusts too late, pats a tame slap to cover, and the leggie has struck!

he's upper cut the ball to deep point. Good grief. Stands forlorn as he watches Santner running in from the boundary and sealing the catch with some style. It is short. It is asking to be hit. It becomes a wicket. There's something very scoreboard pressure about this wicket. That, or I'm being kind to a terrible shot

a rush of blood and this is a familiar dismissal for Tamim. Comes down the track and belts a length ball straight to short cover. Dot-ball pressure does him. Well, it isn't exactly pressure. The target is only 251. It's just him feeling bogged down. It's him making a bad mistake

as far as shots go, you have to say that is an absolute shocker from a senior player. Bangladesh wobbling big time. Tamim looks for a ugly slog across the line to a length delivery, only manage a top edge that was swirling in the air for a long time. Broom, running backwards from point, kept his eyes on the ball and then plucked out what could have been a toughie. He's made it look really easy in the end.

another short ball, looks to muscle this over long-on but finds Gunathilaka there. This had a lot of power but he got down low, cupped both hands and allowed them to lodge safely. End of a super knock from Tamim. A tad slow initially, picked up the pace, again slowed down after the century and then again accelerated in quest for quick runs.

leading edge back to Kulasekara. Dolly of a catch, really. Timed his jumped well and took the catch but lost the grip when he was trying to throw the ball up in delight. Grabbed it, swung it around and lost it while in the motion of throwing it up. Fair call in the end, Tamim shakes his head but has to walk off.
its wide of off-stump and Tamim cuts the ball towards the cover boundary. Munro doesn't have to move as it goes right down his throat.

first wicket goes down, its a good length ball and Tamim plays back to the ball. Gets a thin edge and it goes through to the keeper. Appeal goes up and the Umpire takes his time before raising the finger.
its slog swept in the air towards the mid-wicket boundary. Bennett runs over from long-on and takes an excellent sliding catch right in front of us. Tamim goes..

big top edge, and taken! The end of a wonderful innings. Dug in short of a length, but no width, Tamim went for the pull and the ball flew high in the air behind square. Buttler jogged from his position to settle underneath it

oh no, that's an unfortunate end to a good innings. It's that trademark one-legged whip again, but this time he closes the face too early. Wasn't a particularly menacing ball from Starc, short and at leg stump. The top edge carried neatly to long leg

Southee strikes with his second ball. Tamim has been given out lbw by umpire Gould. The batsman chooses to challenge the on-field out decision. But this looks pretty adjacent. This was full on middle, lateral movement now, this swings in slightly, enough to bother the left-hander. Tamim falls across, plays down the wrong line. The tracker returns three reds - it would have carried onto hit the leg stump. Bangladesh's gun batsman gone for a duck

and Jadhav strikes. All those dots and Tamim is forced into a big shot. Straight and accurate from Jadhav, the length isn't full or short. But Tamim wants to hit through midwicket. He misses his slog sweep and the ball goes onto hit leg stump. Done in by pressure and Jadhav's length, not the right option, a cross-batted stroke to that ball

Pretorius wins an lbw appeal with his fourth ball! Slower, full ball from the seamer, Tamim does not spot the change-up and is struck on the flap of the back pad. Was the impact in line? The tracker might have returned umpire's call on impact

Has Dananjaya broken through? Umpire Rahman shakes his head and shoots down the caught-behind appeal. The keeper had also whipped the bails off but think the appeal is for the catch behind the wicket. Dickwella insists a review. Dananjaya dangles it up around off and gets it to break away in the corridor. Tamim wafts away from the body with no feet. Has he nicked this? Ultra Edge detects a spike, and Tamim has to exit. Dickwella was so confident that he did not bother consulting with his captain Chandimal for a review. He himself called for it. Umpire Rahman's on-field not-out call has been reversed. Dananjaya and Dickwella are pumped. Sri Lanka needed this opening. No hundred for Tamim, and the Mirpur crowd has been hushed into silence

outfoxes him! Cremer gets another one with the googly. Good length ball on off stump, hung up generously and dipping fast. Tamim steps out and wants to slog this over the midwicket boundary, but it turns away from him and he's woefully out of shape by the end of it all. Easy stumping for Taylor

Another stunning piece of fielding from Danushka. His brilliance in the field has sent back both Shakib and Tamim. He throws himself to his right from backward point now, stretches out with both hands, and snaffles a catch. Credit to Lakmal too for banging it short just a shade outside off, surprising the batsman and forcing him to splice a catch. It actually reared up from a back of a length

and Tamim looks a gift horse in the mouth. Gives his wicket away next ball. Shortish with zero room. Tamim tries to force a pull. The runs weren't coming and he was desperate. Manages a healthy top-edge that is taken at midwicket
